reviews.title: UTO IS A SCAM - Don't Book With Them

reviews.title: SCAM SCAM SCAM - DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY
text: Like many others, UTOvacation is a horrible company that will SCAM you out of your money. I purchased a tour to China and Japan, originally supposed to start in October 2023.  I was then informed that the trip had to be rescheduled due to Covid 19 for the next year, October 2024.

Here I am, 30 days out in September, and I have not heard from UTO, as they are supposed to provide your final travel confirmations with flight, hotel, and tour guide 30 days before the departure date, which would have been September 24, when I was supposed to receive the finalized documents. I had to call them because of non-receipt. They told me that the tour was rescheduled again for October 2025 due to Monkeypox, which is not a major outbreak in China, after I did some research.

The representative sent me information that I did not agree to, giving a credit of $1000 something dollars for a tour that I already paid in full. The credit expires in March of 2025 (I did not agree to receive a credit), and then they stated that the remaining amount was applied to the rescheduled tour, and I would need to pay the difference.  There's no way to get your money back.
The online chat is horrible; if you call, you will get hung up repeatedly after holding.
I believe the only reason I received a call back was for them to provide an excuse that the trip was rescheduled.

The time period to submit a chargeback has since expired, and even if I wanted to go on any of their other trips, they are priced ridiculously high, which doesn't make any sense.  Before you get scammed, please read all the reviews, and you will see a consistent pattern of the same type of issues that people have experienced.  Don't lose your money or put any travel faith in this company.

reviews.title: Beware of UTOvacation
text: BEWARE - In my opinion, you would be wise to NOT BOOK with untrustworthy
UTOvacation

Let me begin by introducing myself. I am a retired travel professional from North Carolina. I have a 40-year career in the travel industry; as a Travel Agent, a Travel Agency Owner, a Tour Planner, and an International Tour Guide.  I have traveled widely on international tour packages sponsored by Travelzoo, and have had many superlative experiences.  UNTIL, I recently booked with UTOvacation based in Toronto, Canada.  We placed a $5908 deposit on a 5-star Egyptian ‚ÄúTouch of the Exotic Tour‚Äù and were attempting to call in our final payment of $8698, when things went south. The final payment deadline was still about 14 days in the future, and when we called to give them the payment, we were thrown into a telephone recording loop that advised that we would be disconnected if no one answered in 3 minutes. After about 10-12 tries and disconnects, in desperation we even tried their phone prompt that would direct us to the ‚Äúbook a new tour‚Äù line (thinking surely they would prioritize incoming money), only to have the same results - no answer and then disconnected after 3 minutes. We tried this over and over again throughout the next 2 business days during their opening hours with the same result.  This was unprecedented and worrisome and therefore, we began to look for reviews on line. There was an exhaustive list of scathing reviews on each site we investigated, claiming the company was a scam, not delivering on parts of tours or quality of hotels that were promised, not giving refunds that were due, cancelling tours at the last minute and only providing a credit for a similar future tour, which turned out to have hyper-inflated pricing - sometimes triple the cost of the first trip.  When we checked the Better Business Bureau site, UTOvacation rating had a big ‚ÄúREVOKED‚Äù banner stamped on it.  So we canceled our trip by email, 10 days prior to the final payment deadline, requesting a full refund on our deposit, and to date they have returned only approximately ¬º of our deposit.

In my opinion, you would be wise to not add your name to the list of upset and dissatisfied customers unable to get money back or having poor travel experiences; save your precious travel dollars to spend with a tour company who has a consistently good reputation.
Update:  UTOvacation rating disappeared from the US Better Business Bureau and has now reappeared with no history or complaints, nor any accreditation.
